page.title: 20TRANSPORT/COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: A bus meets all the scheduled flights at Sumburgh and runs to Lerwick in the north. Also a scheduled bus service runs from Exnaboe to Lerwick at 8am and 1030am, returning in the afternoon aqnd evening. From May to September a ferry boat runs from Grutness Pier to Fair Isle a distance of some 40km. It runs twice weekly in summer and weekly in the winter. There are three large communication systems for the airport and defence. At the small village of Toab there is a post office and public telephone. Also at the Hamlet of Grutness there is a public telephone. The airport has extensive communication systems for internal and external use.
